title: Municipal Layer Value Recognition for Middle-Aged Adult
description: As a middle-aged adult in the value scanner system Operating at the municipal governance layer I want to influence municipal policy and infrastructure based on my care economy experience So that municipal systems better support families managing multigenerational care responsibilities

Feature: Municipal Layer Value Recognition for Middle-Aged Adult
  As a middle-aged adult in the value scanner system
  Operating at the municipal governance layer
  I want to influence municipal policy and infrastructure based on my care economy experience
  So that municipal systems better support families managing multigenerational care responsibilities

  Background:
    Given the Elohim Protocol is operational
    And the middle-aged user "Robert" is registered in the system
    And Robert is 52 years old with decades of care economy experience
    And the municipal governance context is active
    And municipal_elohim coordinates municipal care economy infrastructure
    And Robert pays property taxes and participates in municipal civic life

  Scenario: Municipal elder care policy informed by caregiver experience
    Given Robert coordinates care for parents ages 78 and 75
    And he's navigated municipal elder care systems
    And he understands what works and what's missing
    When municipal_elohim connects his experience to policy development
    Then it should channel his feedback to municipal elder care planning
    And surface his expertise to municipal aging services
    And help him advocate for caregiver support programs
    And connect him to municipal boards and advisory committees
    And ensure municipal policy reflects actual caregiver needs
    And recognize that users of systems should shape policy
    And build elder care infrastructure based on lived experience

  Scenario: Municipal work-family policy advocacy based on personal navigation
    Given Robert balances intense career demands with family care
    And he's learned that work-family balance requires systemic support
    And municipal policy can support or hinder work-family balance
    When municipal_elohim supports his policy advocacy
    Then it should connect him to municipal work-family policy development
    And help him advocate for paid family leave, flexible work policies, and caregiver protections
    And surface opportunities to testify or serve on municipal commissions
    And recognize his experience as policy expertise
    And channel his voice toward municipal employment standards
    And build municipal support for working caregivers
    And demonstrate that care economy requires policy transformation

  Scenario: Municipal resource allocation reflects care economy priorities
    Given Robert participates in municipal budget processes
    And care economy principles should inform resource allocation
    And municipal budgets often underfund care infrastructure
    When municipal_elohim supports budget advocacy
    Then it should help him understand municipal budget priorities
    And surface opportunities to advocate for care infrastructure funding
    And connect him to budget hearings and participatory budgeting
    And help him articulate how care infrastructure serves community wellbeing
    And support advocacy for elder care, childcare, and caregiver support funding
    And build municipal budgets that prioritize care economy
    And demonstrate that care should be public infrastructure priority

  Scenario: Municipal planning includes middle-aged caregiver voice
    Given Robert represents large demographic managing multigenerational care
    And municipal planning often misses caregiver needs
    And his experience could improve municipal systems
    When municipal_elohim connects him to planning processes
    Then it should identify municipal planning opportunities
    And help him participate in comprehensive planning, transportation planning, and housing policy
    And surface how planning decisions affect caregivers
    And advocate for aging-in-place infrastructure, accessible transportation, and multigenerational housing
    And ensure municipal planning reflects caregiver perspectives
    And build municipalities that support care economy
    And recognize that planning should serve actual resident needs

  Scenario: Municipal aging infrastructure influenced by sandwich generation
    Given Robert manages care for both aging parents and adult children
    And he understands infrastructure needs across lifecycle
    And municipal aging infrastructure often inadequate
    When municipal_elohim supports aging infrastructure advocacy
    Then it should connect Robert to municipal aging policy development
    And help him advocate for adult day care, senior centers, home health support, and transportation
    And surface gaps in current municipal aging infrastructure
    And support him in testifying about infrastructure needs
    And build municipal systems that support aging with dignity
    And demonstrate that aging infrastructure benefits entire community
    And create municipalities where aging is supported, not hidden

  Scenario: Municipal civic participation valued as care contribution
    Given Robert serves on municipal boards and commissions
    And civic participation is care for community
    And his service benefits all residents
    When municipal_elohim tracks civic participation
    Then it should recognize his municipal service as care contribution
    And value civic participation in care token economy
    And track his contributions: planning commission, park board, aging advisory committee
    And demonstrate that governance participation is care work
    And recognize that his civic service strengthens municipal care economy
    And build culture where civic participation is valued as contribution
    And support sustainable civic engagement without exploitation

  Scenario: Municipal services coordinate for multigenerational family support
    Given Robert's family needs span eldercare, young adult support, and household services
    And municipal services are often siloed by department
    And coordinated service delivery would better serve families
    When municipal_elohim coordinates service delivery
    Then it should help Robert navigate municipal services across departments
    And connect aging services, youth programs, housing assistance, and employment support
    And surface relevant municipal resources across his family's needs
    And demonstrate how integrated service delivery serves families
    And advocate for municipal coordination across service silos
    And build municipal systems that recognize multigenerational family reality
    And reduce burden of navigating fragmented municipal services

  Scenario: Municipal data and transparency support informed civic participation
    Given Robert participates in municipal governance
    And effective participation requires access to information
    And municipal data is often hard to access or understand
    When municipal_elohim provides municipal data access
    Then it should surface relevant municipal data for Robert's interests
    And help him understand municipal budgets, demographics, and service utilization
    And provide analysis tools for municipal information
    And support informed civic participation through data transparency
    And demonstrate that democratic governance requires accessible information
    And build municipal transparency that enables resident engagement
    And empower residents to participate meaningfully in governance

  Scenario: Municipal tax policy connects to care economy investment
    Given Robert pays substantial property and income taxes
    And taxes should support care infrastructure
    And he has voice in how tax revenue is used
    When municipal_elohim connects taxation to care economy
    Then it should help him understand how his taxes fund care infrastructure
    And surface opportunities to advocate for care economy tax priorities
    And connect him to municipal revenue and taxation policy discussions
    And support advocacy for progressive taxation that funds care
    And build municipal tax policy that supports care economy
    And demonstrate that taxation is community investment in care
    And recognize that taxpayers should shape spending priorities

  Scenario: Municipal employer influenced through employee advocacy
    Given municipal government is major employer
    And Robert may work for municipality or know municipal employees
    And municipal employment policy sets standards
    When municipal_elohim supports workplace advocacy
    Then it should recognize opportunities to influence municipal employment policy
    And help Robert advocate for municipal employee work-family balance
    And support municipal adoption of care economy employment practices
    And demonstrate that municipal government should model care economy principles
    And build municipal workplace that supports employee caregiving
    And create demonstration that care-friendly employment is possible
    And influence broader employment culture through municipal example

  Scenario: Municipal sustainability and care economy integration
    Given care economy and ecological sustainability are connected
    And Robert's care practices affect environmental sustainability
    And municipal sustainability policy should include care economy
    When municipal_elohim connects care and sustainability
    Then it should help Robert see connections between care economy and ecological sustainability
    And support advocacy for municipal policy that integrates both
    And recognize that care for people and care for planet are linked
    And build municipal sustainability that includes care economy principles
    And demonstrate that sustainable communities require care economy
    And create municipalities that support both human and ecological flourishing
    And recognize that his generation can integrate these priorities

  Scenario: Municipal accountability to care economy principles
    Given Robert and others participate in municipal care economy
    And municipalities should be accountable to care principles
    And municipal decisions affect care economy functioning
    When municipal_elohim monitors municipal accountability
    Then it should track whether municipal policy supports care economy
    And surface when municipal decisions harm caregivers
    And help Robert hold municipality accountable to care principles
    And provide tools for monitoring municipal care economy performance
    And support resident advocacy for accountability
    And build municipal governance that serves care economy
    And demonstrate that municipalities should be accountable to residents' care needs
